imdb.title: Do It Yourself!!
imdb.plot: High school girls working on DIY projects, as they struggle, fail, yet don't give up and see the projects through to their end. The story depicts the lives of those girls as they take the first step toward the future.

episodes.title: What is ''DIY?''
episodes.plot: Serufu Yua begins attending Gatagata Girls' High School after failing to get into the elite Yuuyuu Girls' Vocational High School with her childhood friend Miku "Purin" Suride. On her way to school, Serufu crashes her bicycle but is aided by third year student Rei "Kurei" Yasuku. Wanting to give Rei her thanks, Serufu comes to a hut around the back of school which is revealed to be the DIY Club.

episodes.title: Does ''DIY'' Mean Doing Stuff With Somebody?
episodes.plot: Serufu brings her classmate Takumi Hikage to the DIY Club. While Serufu and Rei work on a bench made out of skis, Takumi tries her hand at making a mosaic sign for the club.

episodes.title: Does ''DIY'' Mean Why Did You Suddenly Show Up?
episodes.plot: A young transfer student from America shows up at the DIY Club. However, her opinions that technology is superior to DIY leads her to squabble with Rei.

episodes.title: "DIY" Means You'll Find It Possible to Feel Comfortable Anywhere
episodes.plot: Miku comes over to Serufu's house while Jobko is visiting. After hitting it off with Miku, Jobko one-sidedly decides to start living at her house.

episodes.title: "DIY" Means Finding a Place to Belong... Finally
episodes.plot: While initially reluctant to let Kokoro join, Rei comes to respect her strength through an arm-wrestling match while Haruko, who knows Kokoro from childhood, gives Kokoro permission to become an outside club member.

episodes.title: "DIY" Means Dull, Unexciting Items Come in Handy!
episodes.plot: The DIY Club, accompanied by Miku, go to the beach to gather materials such as driftwood and shells they can use to make accessories they can sell to raise funds for their treehouse.

episodes.title: "DIY" Means You Can Do Things Inside If It's Gloomy Out
episodes.plot: As it is both rainy outside and humid inside, the DIY club opts to continue working on the products for the funding of their secret hideout at Rei's house.

episodes.title: "DIY" Means... You Can't Do It? No, I Absolutely Can!
episodes.plot: The DIY club successfully sold a lot of their hand made products. It's time to think of a fitting design to their secret hideout.

episodes.title: Does "DIY" Mean a Shocking Surprise? How Unexpected! So It's Really Unexpected!
episodes.plot: After several days of preparing for the DIY Club and Miku to come over to her house, Serufu reveals she is building a house for Meat to prove herself useful to the others.

episodes.title: "DIY " Means... Rock Bottom? Impossible? With Courage and Drive Anything is Possible!
episodes.plot: With the DIY Club in a funk upon learning that a scheduling error led to their materials being mistaken for industrial waste and disposed of, Miku goes to cheer Serufu up and suggest an alternative way to gather materials.

episodes.title: "DIY" Means Do It Yourself!
episodes.plot: With Miku officially brought on as an external member of the DIY Club, the girls finally begin work on their treehouse with help from Rei's parents.

episodes.title: "DIY" Means Friendship, Always and Forever!
episodes.plot: After the treehouse is finally completed, the girls hold a party where they give farewell gifts to Jobko, who is due to return to America.
